channel.title: cs456 on Jared Rosario
channel.description: Recent content in cs456 on Jared Rosario

item.title: CS456 Notes 02
item.description: Related Question: How do you know the given DFA has the smallest number of states? Often more than one DFA can be there that recognize the same language. DFA Minimization Algorithm: Construct a table being indexed by non-final and final states. Mark all non-final and final pairs (each pair does not have to be connected to one another; as long as they are non-final and final pairs).

item.title: CS456 Notes 03
item.description: What is a Regular Expression? It is a way of denoting regular languages. Rules for regular expression: Empty set ${\empty}$ is a regular expression and denotes language ${\empty}$. Empty string ${lambda}$ is a regular expression denoting set {${\lambda}$}. Each alphabet a is a regular expression and denotes the set {${a}$}. If r and s are regular expressions, then r + s denotes the set ${r \cup s}$. if r and s are regular expressions, then rs denotes concatenation r with s.

item.title: CS456 Notes 01
item.description: What is a Power-Set? Power set of ${2^s}$ of set s is the set of all subsets of S. Examples: ${S_1} = $ {a, b} ${2^{S_1}} = $ {{a}, {b}, {ab}, {0}} ${2^2} = 4$ total elements ${S_2} = $ {a, b, c} ${2^{S_2}} = $ {{0}, {a}, {b}, {c}, {a,b}, {a,c}, {b,c}, {a,b,c}, } ${2^3} = 8$ total elements What are features of deterministic accepters? Process an input string, which consist of a sequence of symbols Make transitions from one state to another state (depending on current state and current input symbol).

item.title: CS456 Notes 00
item.description: What is an alphabet? It is a non-empty finite set of symbols. Ex: $\Sigma$ = {0,1} $\Sigma$ = {a, b, c} $\Sigma$ = {a, b, c, … z} What is a string? It is a finite sequence of symbols from an alphabet. Ex: $\Sigma$ = {a, b, c} w1 = “abc” - This is a string of 3 symbols. w2 = “acaba” - This is a string of 5 symbols.
